content: In this section, we are going to concatenate 4 read files from one sample into 1 and perform Fastqc, multiqc, and Trim_galore to check the quality.
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: Summary In this section, we are going to concatenate 4 read files from the same sample into 1 file and perform Fastqc, multiqc, and Trim_galore to check the quality of each read data.
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 1. Concatenation of raw read files First of all, the operating system (OS) I used is Linux Ubuntu 20.04.4. And what I have in my hand are 64 raw read fastq.gz files. What we need to do first is to concatenate 4 files into one, for example: File name (before) File name(after) LAB_273_17_‚Ä¶_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz LAB_273_17_R1.fastq.gz LAB_273_17_‚Ä¶_L002_R1_001.fastq.gz LAB_273_17_‚Ä¶_L003_R1_001.fastq.gz LAB_273_17_‚Ä¶_L004_R1_001.fastq.gz in Linux, open the terminal for name in *.fastq.gz; do printf '%s\n' "${name%_*_*_R[12]*}" done | uniq | while read prefix; do cat "$prefix"*R1*.fastq.gz >"${prefix}_R1.fastq.gz" cat "$prefix"*R2*.fastq.gz >"${prefix}_R2.fastq.gz" done Then check whether they are concatenated or not.
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 2. Use fastqc to perform quality checks Here is the homepage for fastqc and you can easily follow the instructions. https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/download.html#fastqc
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 2.1 installing Java Runtime Environment (JRE) sudo apt install default-jre Then check whether JRE is properly installed: java -version
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 2.2 installing Fastqc software sudo -i apt install fastqc fastqc -version
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 2.3 Run fastqc fastqc *.gz which means fastqc all files with .gz you will get one html file for 1 sample like XXXX_fastqc.html
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 3. Using multiqc to summarize the results of fastqc
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis
Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 3.2 installing python conda create --name py3.7 python=3.7 conda activate py3.7 python -version
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 3.3 installing multiqc conda install -c bioconda -c conda-forge multiqc
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 3.4 Run multiqc multiqc . #run multiqc for all fastqc reults files (.html)
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis

content: 4. Discussion For detailed explanation of each result in fastqc and multiqc, I will generate another article for it~ üòâ
title: Preparation of clean read data for RNA-seq data analysis
